intro: Pimelea sulphurea var. macrocephala, commonly known as the golden everlasting, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is typically found in heathlands and open woodlands. It is a member of the family Thymelaeaceae and is known for its long-lasting blooms. The variety macrocephala is distinguished by its larger, more prominent flower heads compared to the typical form.
